primaryOutcome.outcome: To evaluate the efficacy (overall response rate) of a risk-adjusted outpatient-based approach to lymphoma salvage therapy with VGF (vinorelbine, gemcitabine and pegfilgrastim) and/or F-GIV (gemcitabine, Ifosfamide, vinorelbine and pegfilgrastim).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: After two cycles and after four cycles

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- age > 18 years
- relapsed or primary refractory non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (NHL) or Hodgkin's Disease (HD)
- ECOG 0 - 2
- written informed consent
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
Exclusion criteria:
- Intention to proceed with any form of transplant therapy following fewer than 2 cycles of protocol salvage therapy
- bilirubin > 50Âµmol/litre unless secondary to lymphoma
- creatinine > 2 x upper limit of normal unless secondary to lymphoma, absolute neutrophil count <0.5 x 109/litre and / or platelets < 50 x 109/litre unless secondary to lymphoma
- relapse within 6 months of a prior transplant procedure (autologous or allogeneic)
- known sensitivity to E coli derived preparations

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is a Phase II trial evaluating the efficacy (overall response rate) of a risk-adjusted outpatient based approach to lymphoma salvage therapy with vinorelbine, gemcitabine and pegfilgrastim and/or gemcitabine, ifosfamide, vinorelbine and pegfilgrastim.
